question: Is L-4F an apoE mimetic peptide?
ideal_answer: No, L-4F is an apoA-I mimetic peptide.

snippets.text: Apolipoprotein A-I mimetic peptide 4F suppresses tumor-associated macrophages and pancreatic cancer progression.
L-4F, an Apolipoprotein A-I (ApoA-I) mimetic peptide, is engineered to mimic the anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidative functionalities of ApoA-I.
